label: Nourishment
i_ching_name: Yi / The Corners of the Mouth

shadow.name: SELFISHNESS
shadow.description: Hoarding resources, taking without giving back
shadow.behavioral_signature: Overprotection of resources, guilt about receiving
shadow.somatic_signature: Tight jaw, clenched teeth, difficulty swallowing
shadow.thought_pattern: There's not enough. I need to keep everything for myself.

gift.name: CARING
gift.description: Responsible stewardship, knowing who and what to nourish
gift.somatic_signature: Relaxed jaw, clear boundaries around resources
gift.thought_pattern: I care for what's mine to care for. No more, no less.

siddhi.name: SELFLESSNESS
siddhi.description: Pure nourishment that serves the whole without depletion
siddhi.behavioral_signature: Effortless giving that regenerates the giver
siddhi.thought_pattern: What I give away returns multiplied.

inversion_protocols.script: You are not selfish for having limits. The Sacral's role is to respond with a clear yes or no. When you override your no to be 'nice,' you deplete your life force. True caring requires boundaries. You cannot nourish others from an empty well.
inversion_protocols.somatic_anchor: Notice the quality of your 'yes.' Does it come from obligation or from genuine response? Feel the difference in your gut.

experiment.hypothesis: If I honor every sacral no for 5 days, my energy will increase.
experiment.action: Practice saying 'no' to anything that doesn't generate a clear sacral yes. Notice the response.

success_criteria.target: More energy at end of day, fewer resentments
